ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Trades

Class Trade

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Elastic.ElasticStorable
      • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Trades.Trade
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable

    public class Trade
extends ElasticStorable
implements Observable
    Trade object which holds all relevant information for a trade. Each trade has an inventory which is a list of the items involved in the trade, a unique TradeManager for the borrower and the owner, and a status. A borrower's inventory must contain 0 or more items. The owner's inventory will contain one item.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trade

        public Trade(Inventory offeredTrinkets,
     TradeManager receiver,
     Inventory requestedTrinkets,
     TradeManager sender)
        Constructor that initializes the sender and receiver sides of the trade. Both parties are initialized with their own Inventories (holding the trinkets they are bartering in this trade) and their own TradeManagers. When a new trade is initialized, the current user who is requesting the trade is the "sender" and the friend who the request is being sent to is the "receiver". By default the trade's status is set to "pending", meaning that the negotiation is still in progress and the trade has neither been accepted nor rejected yet.

        Parameters:
        offeredTrinkets - inventory containing offered trinkets
        receiver - TradeManager of user who was offered the trade
        requestedTrinkets - inventory containing requested trinkets
        sender - TradeManager of user who instantiated trade

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        If hasChanged() returns true, calls the update() method for every observer in the list of observers using null as the argument. Afterwards, calls clearChanged().

        Equivalent to calling notifyObservers(null).

        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface Observable

      • getNumberOfTrinkets

        public java.lang.Integer getNumberOfTrinkets()
        Returns number of trinkets involved in a particular trade. Depending on who this method is called on it will return the number of trinkets that either the sender or receiver has involved in the trade.

        Returns:
        Integer Number of offered or requested trinkets in trade

      • setNumberOfTrinkets

        public void setNumberOfTrinkets(java.lang.Integer numberOfTrinkets)
        Sets number of trinkets in a particular trade. Depending on who this method is called on it will set the number of trinkets that either the sender or receiver has involved in the trade.

        Parameters:
        numberOfTrinkets - Number of offered or requested trinkets in a trade

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method override is responsible for determining how trades will be shown to the user when they view their Current Trades list and Past Trades list.

        For each trade in the list, it's number, the other person involved in the trade (not LoggedInUser) and it's status will be displayed. The number for a trade is it's index + 1 in the list it belongs to in the TradeArchiver (currentTrades or pastTrades).

        If a trade has not yet been clicked (viewed) by a user, NEW! will also be displayed.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String Text displayed for each trade in current trades list of ActiveTradesActivity and in past trades list of PastTradesActivity

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus()
        Returns status of the trade. Can be pending, accepted, or declined. Current(active) trades have a status of pending. Past (inactive) trades have a status of accepted or declined.

        Returns:
        String - Status of trade (pending, accepted or declined)

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(java.lang.String status)
        Sets status of a trade. Can be pending, accepted, or declined. Current(active) trades have a status of pending. Past (inactive) trades have a status of accepted or declined.

        Parameters:
        status - - String representing status of trade (pending, accepted or declined)

      • toEmailString

        public java.lang.String toEmailString()
        Creates a formatted string describing the trade. It includes which users were involved in the trade and the items they were trading. This string is sent as an email to both users involved in the trade when the user who the trade was proposed to clicks the "Accept" button in the TradeReceivedActivity.

        Returns:
        String - a formatted string describing a trade that was just accepted. This string is intended to be sent as a confirmation to both parties involved in an accepted trade.

      • getSender

        public TradeManager getSender()
        Returns TradeManager of sender of trade (user who proposes trade offer).

        Returns:
        TradeManager - TradeManager of user who instantiated trade

      • getOfferedTrinkets

        public Inventory getOfferedTrinkets()
        Returns the trinket offered by trade sender. The current user who is proposing the trade is the sender. They will offer 1 trinket in the trade, which will be returned in an inventory.

        Returns:
        Inventory - Inventory containing offered trinkets

      • getReceiver

        public TradeManager getReceiver()
        Returns TradeManager of receiver of trade (user who receives trade offer).

        Returns:
        TradeManager - TradeManager of user who was offered the trade

      • getRequestedTrinkets

        public Inventory getRequestedTrinkets()
        Return trinket(s) requested by trade sender. The current user who is proposing the trade is the sender. They may request 0 or more trinkets in the trade they are proposing. All items they are requesting will be returned. If they are requesting no items then an empty Inventory is returned.

        Returns:
        Inventory - Inventory containing requested trinkets
